intro: Chomelia chiquitensis, commonly known as the Chiquitain chomelia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in parts of Bolivia and Paraguay. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
